anucaritaṃ.sutta_1: ‘yampi me diṭṭhaṃ sutaṃ mutaṃ viññātaṃ pattaṃ pariyesitaṃ anupariyesitaṃ anucaritaṃ manasā tampi na upādiyissāmi, na ca me tannissitaṃ viññāṇaṃ bhavissatī’ti.
anucaritaṃ.example_1: ‘I shall not grasp whatever is seen, heard, thought, known, attained, sought, and explored by my mind, and my consciousness will not have that as support.’

dhammikathanti.example_1: atha kho mahāpajāpatigotamī pañcamattehi bhikkhunisatehi saddhiṃ yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi. ekamantaṃ ṭhitā kho mahāpajāpatigotamī bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, ovadatu, bhante, bhagavā bhikkhuniyo, anusāsatu, bhante, bhagavā bhikkhuniyo, karotu, bhante, bhagavā bhikkhunīnaṃ dhammiṃ kathanti [dhammikathanti] .

sañchindeyya.sutta_1: yaṃ yadeva tattha antarā vilimaṃsaṃ antarā nhāru antarā bandhanaṃ taṃ tadeva tiṇhena govikantanena sañchindeyya saṅkanteyya sampakanteyya samparikanteyya.
sañchindeyya.example_1: they’d cut, carve, sever, and slice through the connecting tendons, sinews, and ligaments with a sharp meat cleaver,

sañchinditvā.sutta_1: sañchinditvā saṅkantitvā sampakantitvā samparikantitvā vidhunitvā bāhiraṃ cammakāyaṃ teneva cammena taṃ gāviṃ paṭicchādetvā evaṃ vadeyya:
sañchinditvā.example_1: and then peel off the outer hide. Then they’d wrap that cow up in that very same hide and say:

upacayaṃ.sutta_1: tassa sārattassa saṃyuttassa sammūḷhassa assādānupassino viharato āyatiṃ pañcupādānakkhandhā upacayaṃ gacchanti.
upacayaṃ.example_1: Someone who lives aroused like this—fettered, confused, concentrating on gratification—accumulates the five grasping aggregates for themselves in the future.
